items.content: President Trump said on Saturday he will send troops to Portland, Oregon, as his deployments expand to more cities across the U.S.

items.title: Trump authorises 'full force' as Portland becomes latest city to see troops deployed
items.standfirst: The president says the latest move to send troops to a major US city is "necessary" to protect immigration detention facilities.
items.content: The president says the latest move to send troops to a major US city is "necessary" to protect immigration detention facilities.

items.title: Trump authorises ‘full force’ as he orders troops to Portland to protect ‘war-ravaged’ city

items.content: Move to protect immigration enforcement facilities is fourth deployment in Democrat-controlled US cities

items.title: Donald Trump says he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon
items.standfirst: Apparently misled by hyperbolic reporting from conservative outlets on a single small protest, president described peaceful city as ‘war ravaged’Donald Trump said on Saturday he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office.Trump made the announcement on social media, using references to antifascists and US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice). He claimed that the deployment was necessary “to protect War ravaged Portland, and any of our (immigration and customs enforcement) Facilities under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Continue reading...
items.content: Apparently misled by hyperbolic reporting from conservative outlets on a single small protest, president described peaceful city as ‘war ravaged’Donald Trump said on Saturday he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office.Trump made the announcement on social media, using references to antifascists and US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice). He claimed that the deployment was necessary “to protect War ravaged Portland, and any of our (immigration and customs enforcement) Facilities under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump announces deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon to handle ‘domestic terrorists’
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he was authorizing the deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon, which he described as “under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Portland is the latest city targeted by the Trump administration for deployments following announcements regarding Chicago, Memphis, Washington, DC and Los Angeles.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he was authorizing the deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon, which he described as “under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Portland is the latest city targeted by the Trump administration for deployments following announcements regarding Chicago, Memphis, Washington, DC and Los Angeles.

items.title: Trump Orders US Troops to Portland, Authorizes ‘Full Force’

ai_summary: Trump announced he would send troops to Portland, Oregon, on social media.
The move is to protect immigration enforcement facilities, according to Trump.
Local officials and the state's delegation opposed the deployment.
Trump described Portland as "war ravaged" in his announcement.
This is the fourth deployment of troops to Democrat-controlled cities.

items.content: Gustavo Petro told US soldiers to "disobey Trump's orders" while addressing a protest in New York.

items.title: US revokes visa for Colombian president Gustavo Petro after ‘reckless’ actions in New York
items.standfirst: At a pro-Palestine protest, Petro urged US soldiers to ‘disobey Trump’s order’ and ‘not point their rifles at humanity’The US state department said on Friday it would revoke the visa of Colombian leftist president Gustavo Petro for his “incendiary actions” during a pro-Palestinian street protest in New York.“Earlier today, Colombian president @petrogustavo stood on a NYC street and urged US soldiers to disobey orders and incite violence,” the state department said on X. Continue reading...
items.content: At a pro-Palestine protest, Petro urged US soldiers to ‘disobey Trump’s order’ and ‘not point their rifles at humanity’The US state department said on Friday it would revoke the visa of Colombian leftist president Gustavo Petro for his “incendiary actions” during a pro-Palestinian street protest in New York.“Earlier today, Colombian president @petrogustavo stood on a NYC street and urged US soldiers to disobey orders and incite violence,” the state department said on X. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The U.S. State Department revoked Colombian President Gustavo Petro's visa.
Petro urged U.S. soldiers to disobey President Trump's orders at a protest.
The protest was a pro-Palestinian demonstration in New York City.
Petro responded to the visa revocation with the statement "I don't care".
The move is likely to strain relations between the U.S. and Colombia.

items.content: Humberto rapidly strengthened into a major hurricane as it churned over the Atlantic Ocean, the National Hurricane Center said.

items.title: Tropical depression forms near Bahamas as Hurricane Humberto rips through the Atlantic

items.content: The National Hurricane Center said Saturday that a disturbance near the Bahamas has strengthened into Tropical Depression Nine and is expected to intensify into a tropical storm later in the evening, possibly reaching hurricane strength by early next week.

ai_summary: A tropical depression near the Caribbean could intensify, heading toward the East Coast.
South Carolina's governor declared a state of emergency.
Hurricane Humberto strengthened to a major hurricane in the Atlantic.
Humberto could interact with another storm, creating a rare Fujiwhara effect.
Tropical Cyclone Nine is also developing in the Atlantic.

clusters.title: At least 36 dead and more than 50 injured in stampede at Vijay rally in India
clusters.neutral_headline: Stampede at Indian Political Rally Kills Dozens

items.title: At least 36 dead and more than 50 injured in stampede at Vijay rally in India
items.standfirst: Victims include eight children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politician At least 36 people have been killed and more than 50 injured in a stampede at a rally for a popular actor and politician in India.The health minister in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu, Ma Subramanian, told the Associated Press late on Saturday that the victims, including eight children, were dead by the time they arrived at hospital. Continue reading...
items.content: Victims include eight children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politician At least 36 people have been killed and more than 50 injured in a stampede at a rally for a popular actor and politician in India.The health minister in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu, Ma Subramanian, told the Associated Press late on Saturday that the victims, including eight children, were dead by the time they arrived at hospital. Continue reading...

items.content: Tens of thousands had gathered at a campaign event for actor-turned-politician Vijay in the southern state of Tamil Nadu.

items.title: At least 31 dead after stampede in India
items.standfirst: A stampede during a political rally in southern India killed at least 31 people on Saturday. The incident took place at a road show organized by the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam political party in Karur,...
items.content: A stampede during a political rally in southern India killed at least 31 people on Saturday. The incident took place at a road show organized by the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam political party in Karur,...

items.title: At least 36 people killed at rally for Indian actor Vijay
items.standfirst: At least 36 people have been killed and dozens injured during a stampede at a rally for actor-turned-politician Vijay - a huge star in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu.
items.content: At least 36 people have been killed and dozens injured during a stampede at a rally for actor-turned-politician Vijay - a huge star in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

ai_summary: A stampede at a political rally in India killed at least 36 people.
The rally was for actor-turned-politician Vijay in Tamil Nadu.
Eight children were among the victims of the stampede.
Over 50 people were injured in the incident.
The incident occurred at a road show organized by a political party.

clusters.title: Fact check: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu’s speech at the UNGA
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu's UN Speech Sparks Controversy and Walkouts

items.title: Fact check: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu’s speech at the UNGA
items.standfirst: Netanyahu faces diplomatic isolation at the United Nations General Assembly.
items.content: Netanyahu faces diplomatic isolation at the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: Netanyahu makes bold address as U.N. amid delegate walkouts, protests
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the United Nations General Assembly in New York City on Friday. The leader made defiant statements about the countries that recently recognized the Palestinian state, while U.N. delegates walked out.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the United Nations General Assembly in New York City on Friday. The leader made defiant statements about the countries that recently recognized the Palestinian state, while U.N. delegates walked out.

items.title: Netanyahu tells UN that Israel ‘must finish the job’ in Gaza after dozens of delegates walk out in protest - as it happened
items.standfirst: Israeli PM rebuked Western nations for embracing Palestinian statehood after scores of delegates left the hall in protest. This live blog is closedNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outPalestinians living in poverty were also affected, the Palestinian prime minister’s spokesperson Mohammad Abu al-Rob told Agence France-Presse (AFP), with their numbers rising by more than 150% since the start of the Gaza war, and with cash assistance not paid out in more than two months.An increase in the number of Israeli checkpoints in the West Bank, and a reduction in work permits for West Bank Palestinians seeking work inside Israel have had a drastic impact. Continue reading...
items.content: Israeli PM rebuked Western nations for embracing Palestinian statehood after scores of delegates left the hall in protest. This live blog is closedNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outPalestinians living in poverty were also affected, the Palestinian prime minister’s spokesperson Mohammad Abu al-Rob told Agence France-Presse (AFP), with their numbers rising by more than 150% since the start of the Gaza war, and with cash assistance not paid out in more than two months.An increase in the number of Israeli checkpoints in the West Bank, and a reduction in work permits for West Bank Palestinians seeking work inside Israel have had a drastic impact. Continue reading...

items.title: Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu’s speech to UN into Gaza
items.standfirst: Operation prompts outrage as Israeli PM criticises western countries for recognising Palestine as a state and pledges to continue warNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outIsraeli military loudspeaker systems have broadcast Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to the UN into Gaza in an unprecedented operation that immediately prompted controversy and outrage.In a statement on Friday, an Israeli government spokesperson said: “As part of the public diplomacy effort, the prime minister’s office has directed civilian elements, in cooperation with the [Israel Defense Forces], to place loudspeakers on the backs of trucks on the Israeli side of the Gaza border so that Prime Minister Netanyahu’s historic UN general assembly speech will be heard in the Gaza Strip.” Continue reading...
items.content: Operation prompts outrage as Israeli PM criticises western countries for recognising Palestine as a state and pledges to continue warNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outIsraeli military loudspeaker systems have broadcast Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to the UN into Gaza in an unprecedented operation that immediately prompted controversy and outrage.In a statement on Friday, an Israeli government spokesperson said: “As part of the public diplomacy effort, the prime minister’s office has directed civilian elements, in cooperation with the [Israel Defense Forces], to place loudspeakers on the backs of trucks on the Israeli side of the Gaza border so that Prime Minister Netanyahu’s historic UN general assembly speech will be heard in the Gaza Strip.” Continue reading...

items.title: Netanyahu blasts recognition of Palestinian state as 'shameful' in speech U.N. delegates walked out on
items.standfirst: Facing down a mass walkout and mounting diplomatic pressure, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday to “finish the job” as he defied growing isolation over his military’s devastating assault on the Gaza Strip
items.content: Facing down a mass walkout and mounting diplomatic pressure, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday to “finish the job” as he defied growing isolation over his military’s devastating assault on the Gaza Strip

ai_summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu addressed the UN General Assembly.
Delegates walked out during Netanyahu's speech.
Netanyahu criticized countries recognizing Palestinian statehood.
Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu's speech into Gaza.
The speech prompted outrage and controversy.

items.title: Harrods Warns Customers of Data Theft in Latest IT Breach
items.standfirst: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.
items.content: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.

items.title: Harrods warns customers their data may have been stolen in IT breach
items.standfirst: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...
items.content: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Harrods department store reported a customer data breach.
The breach involved the systems of a third-party provider.
Names and contact details of online customers were taken.
Passwords and payment details were not affected.
This is the latest in a series of IT breaches in the UK.

clusters.title: Denmark and Norway report new drone sightings over major military bases
clusters.neutral_headline: Drones Spotted Over Military Bases in Denmark and Norway

items.title: Denmark and Norway report new drone sightings over major military bases
items.standfirst: Unidentified drones spotted at the countries’ biggest military bases, Karup in Denmark and Orland in NorwayUnidentified drones have been spotted over major military bases in Denmark and Norway, the latest in a series of sightings some officials have hinted might be linked to Russia.Drones were spotted on Friday night flying over Danish military sites including Karup, its largest base, while nearby Norway was also investigating “possible sightings of drones” early on Saturday near its biggest military base, Orland. Continue reading...
items.content: Unidentified drones spotted at the countries’ biggest military bases, Karup in Denmark and Orland in NorwayUnidentified drones have been spotted over major military bases in Denmark and Norway, the latest in a series of sightings some officials have hinted might be linked to Russia.Drones were spotted on Friday night flying over Danish military sites including Karup, its largest base, while nearby Norway was also investigating “possible sightings of drones” early on Saturday near its biggest military base, Orland. Continue reading...

items.content: Drones were detected near its largest military facility, with possible sightings also reported in Germany, Norway and Lithuania.

items.content: Unidentified drones seen at several places, including the biggest army base, after a slew of earlier sightings.

ai_summary: Drones were spotted over military bases in Denmark and Norway.
The bases include Karup in Denmark and Orland in Norway.
The sightings are the latest in a series of drone incidents.
Some officials suggest a possible link to Russia.
Drones were also possibly sighted in Germany and Lithuania.

items.title: Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
items.standfirst: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...
items.content: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Officials name Robert Eugene Brashers in brutal deaths of Amy Ayers, Eliza Thomas and Jennifer and Sarah HarbisonAfter more than three decades, police have identified a dead suspect in an infamous 1991 murder case in which four girls were slain at a yogurt shop in Austin, Texas.Austin police revealed Friday that Robert Eugene Brashers had been identified as a suspect in the murders through “a wide range of DNA testing”. items.content: TikTok’s Chinese parent company will likely get about half of the profit from the platform’s US operation even after it sells majority ownership to American investors as part of a deal orchestrated by President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: TikTok Gets $14 Billion Proposed Price Tag in Trump Deal
items.standfirst: The $14 billion price tag for TikTok’s US business cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. The estimate comes as President Donald Trump pushes forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.

items.title: TikTok’s $14 Billion Valuation in Trump Deal Stuns Investors

items.content: The $14 billion valuation that the Trump administration has estimated for TikTok’s US business falls well below projections, surprising investors who say a deal at that price would be a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC.

items.title: Trump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US owners
items.standfirst: Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stakeDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...
